--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "Kenneth Stanley" <kstanley@c...> wrote:
> Sounds like an interesting project; I haven't heard of someone 
doing 
> stock predicition with NEAT before.  What kind of data are you 
> thinking of using for input? 

To do the training I have written some perl scripts to site scrape 
historical price data off yahoo finance. I now have a database of 
17,000 stocks from Europe and America, with historical end of day 
data for each. Some (e.g. IBM) going back as far as 1962. Adding the 
days of trading for all these stocks gives 29 million trading days, 
with open,high,low,close and volume for each day. There should be 
plenty there for training and testing.

As for how I'm going to use this data to provide inputs to a neural 
net and use it to compose a fitness function for the GA....I have 
some well developed ideas but I don't think this is the best place to 
discuss them. If anyone wants to collaborate on the NEAT side of 
things I'll happily divulge my ideas to you - drop me a direct mail.

If anyone wants to download the database (3 large binary files 
containing the raw data) and the C++ classes to access it drop me a 
line and we can sort out an ftp transfer. I can also share the 
scripts I used to do the site scraping, although it would not be a 
good idea if lots of people started using them - the yahoo finance 
site would grind to a halt and they'd probably start making it harder 
to do such things in future :-)

I'm currently trying to get my head around the NEAT C++ code so I may 
well come back with some questions and observations in the near 
future.

Regards,
Emyr
